text: Psalm 101
A Promise to Act with Integrity
Of David. A psalm.\f + \fr Ps 101 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
I will sing of loyal love and justice;
I will sing praises to you, O Yahweh.
I will give attention to \add the\add* way of integrity.
When will you come to me?
I will walk in the integrity of my heart
in the midst of my house.
I will not set before my eyes
any wicked thing.
I hate the work of those who fall away;\f + \fr 101:3 \ft The term “those who fall away” is a rare noun. The verb from the same root is found in \xt Psa 40:5 \ft (4) \f*
it will not cling to me.
A perverse heart will depart from me;
I will not know evil.
One who slanders his neighbor in secret,
him I will destroy.
\add One\add* haughty of eyes and ⸤arrogant⸥\f + \fr 101:5 \ft Literally “wide” \f* of heart,
him I will not endure.
My eyes \add will be\add* on \add the\add* faithful of \add the\add* land,
that \add they may\add* live with me.
\add He who\add* walks in \add the\add* way of integrity,
he shall minister to me.
There will not live in the midst of my house
a worker of deceit.
One who speaks lies
will not remain\f + \fr 101:7 \ft Hebrew “be established” \f* before my eyes.
⸤Each morning⸥,\f + \fr 101:8 \ft Literally “to the mornings” \f*
I will destroy all \add the\add* wicked of \add the\add* land,
cutting off from the city of Yahweh all evildoers.
